channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023110871
item.description:
Report X-2023110871

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap became loose causing an internal leakage, wetting the packaging . We were called to take the hazmat. We tightened the cap and secured the slightly soiled package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap was loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote and the caps were tightened

item.title: Report X-2023110120
item.description:
Report X-2023110120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was pinched causing the bottle to leak, QA was called. We secured the packaged in a lined red tote and cleaned up the floor with neutralizer. DescribePack: Package was pinched causing a bottle to leak from the body DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report E-2023110118
item.description:
Report E-2023110118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 teaspoons of (UN1917) Ethyl Acrylate (3/II) -was released from (1) 55-gallon DM due to improper packaging. Contractors arrived to find that a drum of DOW ethyl Acrylate with a pinhole puncture that released an extremely small amount of product onto the side of the damaged drum and potentially onto the trailer floor. The released material has fully evaporated but as a precaution, all nearby surfaces were treated with a simple green solution and was wiped down with pads. The damaged drum was overpacked and all impacted surfaces were cleaned and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110177
item.description:
Report X-2023110177

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A HAZMAT SPILL ON IR2, RESPONDER USED PPE AND DROVE THE SPILL TUG OVER TO THE LEAK. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW THE CORROSIVE HAZMAT LABEL, RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

Report X-2023110081
